person.persName: Julius H. von Borries (Louisville, Kentucky, cloth merchant and foreign consul)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, cloth merchant and foreign consul. Native of Prussia. Son of Frederic von Borries. Married to Amelia Theodore Mary Bock von Borries in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 4, 1847. Father of Francis von Borries, Emma von Borries, Adolphe von Borries, William von Borries, Julia von Borries, and Helen von Borries. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Partner with Isaac Etlinger in Etlinger & Borries in Louisville from 1851 to 1854. Partner with Herman Beckurts and Louis Helmke in J. Von Borries & Co cloth merchants from 1854 through 1865. Member of the Board of Directors for the Louisville Maine and Fire Insurance Company in Louisville in 1858. Member of the Board of Directors for the Louisville Maine and Fire Insurance Company in Louisville in 1859. Consul for Prussia in Louisville in 1861. Vice president of the Ohio and Kentucky Petroleum and Mining Company in Louisville in 1865.
